revised_title: Brain Structure and Development in Ornithorhynchus Paradoxus
tldr: The author examines the brain structure of the Ornithorhynchus paradoxus, a monotreme, and finds that it lacks a corpus callosum and septum pellucidum. The brain has a simple structure, similar to the brains of embryos of higher mammals, and has a unique decussation or commissure above the anterior commissure. The author also discusses the differences in brain structure between non-placental and placental mammals.
